item.title: 10 minutes
item.description:
5-10 minutes of sun provides ONLY 1,000 IU ONLY IF

  • you are near the equator

  • AND young (seniors 4X longer)

  • AND not obese ( need 3X longer)

  • AND have light skin (Dark Skin need 4X longer)

  • AND it is summer

  • AND it is the middle of the day

  • AND you have lots of skin exposed to the sun

  • AND you are lying down

  • AND you are not wearing sunscreen

item.title: After reaching Vitamin D plateau we need to evaluate response
item.description:
Expecting to give 50,000 IU of Vitamin D weekly (or 7,000 IU) daily to many adults,

    along with some Magnesium and Vitamin K2-7

After the response has plateaued (1 month with loading dose, 3 months otherwise)

everyone should get a vitamin D test to determin if any change is needed
__Test results % Possible reasons for the result Possible actions__
<40 ng
(<100 nmol/L)		 32% Senior, Autistic, Smoker, Obese, slow responder
taking statins, low magnesium, bariatric surgery,
Poor health (consuming vitamin D)

2) gut-friendly vitamin D,
3) probiotics
4) wait for slow responder
40 ng-120 ng
(100-300 nmol/L)		 60% Right on target no change needed if feel benefit
40 ng-120 ng
(100-300 nmol/L)		 5% on target, but not feel any benefit
Vitamin D probably not getting to cell		 Activate Vitamin D receptor

What to do if Poor Kidney, 3 other genes
>120 ng
(>300 nmol/L)		 3% Excessive response
Genes, drugs being taken		 Reduce Vitamin D dose - perhaps by 50%
>200 ng
(500 nmol)		 1% Dangerous response Should person stop taking Vitamin D

item.title: Test of count of items in deficiency category
FAQ for Large Vitamin D Trial
item.description:
Want to add many FAQ items, such as

  • pill boxes are provided - easily see if have taking the pill for the day

    • people who dislike taking pills can get a liquid form

  • participants can choose to be contacted more or less frequently

  • possible blood test 3 months in

      • might alter the form or amount of vitamin D.

  • change of dose based on weight, etc

  • NOT a randomized controlled trial - all participants get the benefit, not just half

item.title: Low Vitamin D is a risk factor for many chronic diseases
item.description:
• GrassrootsHealth - June 2022

GrassrootsHealth - June 2022

Addressing Vitamin D Deficiency Can Save Healthcare Costs, and Lives

Vitamin D is associated with all eight of eight of the chronic diseases reported to be the most expensive

  • Heart Disease and Stroke  (cost the healthcare system $216 billion) (Benjamin et al., 2018)

  • Cancer  (Cancer care costs are expected to reach almost $240 billion by 2030) (Mariotto et al., 2020)

  • Diabetes  (Estimated medical and lost productivity cost of diagnosed diabetes in 2017 was $327 billion) (American Diabetes Association, 2018)

item.title: Magnesium tests
item.description:
Grassroots Health

Blog Post March 2022

Serum Magnesium

Serum is the clear, liquid part of blood, which does not include the red and white blood cells, platelets, and clotting proteins found in whole blood. While serum magnesium is the most widely used measurement for magnesium status (often used in doctors’ and medical offices), it has been recognized as unreliable for diagnosing most cases of magnesium deficiency, especially chronic or subclinical deficiency. Many studies have found a correlation between low magnesium intake and increased risk of disease, however, this relationship often does not correlate with serum magnesium levels.

Increased Vitamin D ==> Prevent and Treat Health problems.

item.title: Vitamin D Help Us Fight Infections - interview of Dr. Thakkar (transcript)
item.description:
Youtube - audio only (transcript below)

Dr Vatsal Thakkar

He is one of the 200+ signers of the open letter: Vitamin D combats COVID-19

Dr. Thakkar takes 10,000 IU daily website [www.vatsalthakkar.com]

A fraction of the signers take >4,000 IU daily

24 slides - which nicely support this podcast

Paradocs podcast note for this episode

Transcript

[music]

Introduction

0:00:08.6 Welcome to The Paradocs with your attending, Doctor Eric Larson . He is a practicing anesthesiologist and clinical assistant professor at Michigan State University College of Human Medicine. Listen in as he takes you behind the scenes of what practicing medicine in today’s ever-changing world is like with another doctor. The Paradocs is a fun and accidentally informative show for physicians, patients, or anyone who has ever found themselves in a waiting room.

item.title: Garth statement
item.description:
My tips for medical researchers:

1. publish raw data so anyone can reanalyze it if they don't agree with the stats.

2. publish preprints and embrace open science

3. work with trained experimental scientists if you/they are not your/themselves (e.g. doctors or nutritionists doing science) forming multidisciplinary coalitions as the quality benefits are massive from these collaborations.

4A. Never ever ever use a p-value again. (They don't mean what people think they do. They've done way more harm than good. They're an awful statistic and should be banned.)

item.title: NFL notes
item.description:
20% False Negative test result (you actually have COVID-19 but test results says no) Science Daily May 26

67% on Day 4, 20% on Day 8, 21% on Day 9, 66% on Day 21 - review of 7 False Negative studies

Note: COVID-19 patients typically not released until no symptoms and test negative twice

https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2020/05/200526173832.htm

How many days after exposure should one be tested to yield the most accurate results, and with which test?

item.title: We need data on COVID-19 prevention by Vitamin D
item.description:
Most of the world wants to prevent COVID-19 (not just treat it)

The immune system can prevent many infections by:

  1. Injecting a vaccine which causes it to create COVID-19 antibodies

      Expensive COVID-19 vaccines might become available in in early 2021

  • Unsure if the vaccines will work and have few side effects

  • Unsure if the vaccine created antibodies will last a long time

  • Unsure if the antibodies will be appropriate for continued COVID-19 muttations

item.title: Proposed Coronavirus Clinical Trials using a Megadose of Vitamin D
item.description:
The healthier an immune system is, the better it is able to fight off attacks.

      both prevention and treatment

There are many ways to fortify the immune system in 2 to 3 months.

A few of the ways provide both prevention and treatment

A megadose of Vitamin D appears to be the only way to provide both prevention and treatment in days

I would like to test two COVID-19 hypotheses and use any positive results this October.

item.title: Strategy to increase health of many people
item.description:
Goal = improved health for most

Must not:

Be too expensive

Take too much time

Take too much effort

Exceed medical guidelines

Should:

Be easy to remember to do

Economically benefit at least one party (employer, insurance, society, individual)

Result in benefits which can be measured in less than a year

Phase 1

Document the benefits of taking 4,000 IU of vitamin D daily

Additional ways to improve health

Educate participants - individuals do not have to wait

item.title: FLU FAQ
item.description:
I already have the flu - might vitamin D help?

Yes – a single 50,000 IU dose of vitamin D typically stops the flu

It is the Vitamin D Hammer for the flu

   “The results are dramatic, with complete resolution of symptoms in 48 to 72 hours”

How quickly can I defend myself against the flu?

Loading doses will restore Vitamin D levels in 3-10 days

Over a million people have had Vitamin D loading doses

item.description:
| | | | | — | — | — | | Stage | days | Aedes-aegypti | | Egg | 2 -400 | long time if egg remains dry | | Larval | 4 | | | Pupa | 2 | | | Adult | 14-30 | Mosquito sips blood/virus from one person
5-10 days later the virus infects mosquito saliva
mosquito spits virus into another person
mosquito lays eggs
mosquito dies |

item.title: Notes on Zika book publishing
item.description:
How the book will be published

  • Online book copy/paste to MS Word English

  • Checks: (corrections made to on-line version)

  1. Spell check

  2. Grammar check (might be combined with Spell check)

  3. Translation check - e.g. translate to Spanish, finding sentences which are translated poorly

Try a different English sentence and use Google translate to check the revised sentence translation

  • Online book + Google translate to Portuguese/Spanish ==> MS Word P/S

Human editors clean-up the translation

item.title: FAQ – Pregnancy
item.description:
Can vitamin D help me get pregnant?

Yes – vitamin D improves the fertility of both the man and the woman, in both Vitamin D also helps with PCOS

Are there side effects, how can I avoid them?

The side effects of vitamin D are extremely rare, and mild, even during pregnancy

I cannot afford the $20 for vitamin D during my pregnancy – what are my options?

One bottle of Vitamin D can be shared among several women. A $20 bottle holds 100 capsules of 50,000 IU of vitamin D. At a low level of dosing (<4,000 IU average daily) one bottle can be used for 4 pregnancies, such that the average cost per pregnancy is just $5.

item.title: Why doctors are so reluctant to try new things like vitamin D
item.description:
Many drugs have drugs have serious, major interactions

More tests are available now (MRI, CAT scan, etc) which, while expensive, should be able to eliminate other possibilities (how many time are they use for confirmation vs elimination?)

Doctors have less time for appointments – so cannot get into the patient history, concerns, – upstream issues

Less time – due to say payment for a 10 mnute appointment as a 25 minute appointment

item.title: Parkinson's and vitamin D
item.description: Center for Disease Control has found a 3X increase in PD deaths during the time that vitamin D has been decreasing

item.title: Find optimal prevention without a long series of random controlled trials
Bio-Tech Pharmacal
item.description:
I have been very happily using Vitamin D capsules from Bio-Tech Pharmacal for the past several years.

The reasons I strongly believe that you should consider Bio-Tech are:

  1. Lowest cost for 50,000 IU vitamin D capsule

I put a yellow colored dot on my desk calendar once every 4 days in the winter,

when the day has that dot on it I take the capsule. And remove the dot

     I realize that most people take supplements daily, but dots my method

item.title: Moving toward protocols for Vitamin D
item.description:
Under construction

Started construction Nov 15, 2013

It appears that there may be some guidance as to how much and what kind of viatmin D a person should take.

They would be similar in some ways to the rules fo playing the bridge card game,

Not precise/exact rules, but rules which work out fairly well. (statistically)

I need to look into the ways that the medical profession documents rules for prescribing.

item.title: 80 ng vitamin D doctor - interview Jan 2013 - admin only
item.description:
This page is currently hidden on VitaminDWiki = only admins can see it

This is a rough draft. There will be extensive re-writing, deleting, re-arranging

Recently retired Family Practice physician in Jan 2013 telephone interview by Henry Lahore of VitaminDWiki

He started a family practice which expanded to having 8,000 patients, most of whom now have vitamin D level 80 ng ± 10 ng.

Grassrootshealth provided him with the target of 80 ng of vitamin D
